humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, metastatic carcinoma is present in 4 out of 9 lymph nodes (as stated in 'PART A RIGHT MODIFIED RADICAL MASTECTOMY: IN SITU AND INFILTRATING DUCTAL CARCINOMA...METASTATIC CARCINOMA IS PRESENT IN 4 OF 9 LYMPH NODES.'). Based on the new rule 12, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. However, the report does not specify the exact number of positive lymph nodes between 1 and 3, so we can only conclude that the N stage is N1 or higher. But since the report does not provide information suggesting N2 or N3 stages, we can predict the N stage to be N1 based on the available information.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'metastatic carcinoma is present in 4 of 9 lymph nodes' which indicates that the cancer has spread to level I or II lymph nodes (N1). There is no information about extranodal extension or the location of the positive lymph nodes, so we cannot make any further substaging.
